{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3336999,"name":"","username":"Mateo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f4b2a3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T14:47:01.899Z","cooked":"

i am using java, and when i enable the robot nothing happens, but as soon as i touch anything on the controller the wheels just jerk forward and backward. i cannot control anything about the drivetrain, neither turning the wheels or controlling the speed. My code: GitHub - Mateo-Johnson/RobustSturdy3

Hard to say without more information, but this type of problem usually results from the motors and their encoders being inverted with respect to each other.

wait the absolute encoders or the inbuilt ones?

Depends, by wheels I assume you mean drive wheels - in that case likely the inbuilt ones.

The encoders you‚Äôre using as PID feedback device, so built in for drive, and absolute for turning.

yeah, the drive wheels. could this be causing the turning motors not to move?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-03-19T17:13:44.056Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":287,"readers_count":286,"score":62.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459255,"topic_slug":"swerve-no-move","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":4297,"username":"Andrew_Schreiber","name":"Andrew Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_schreiber/{size}/209563_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58360,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-no-move/459255/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3337239,"name":"Andrew Schreiber","username":"Andrew_Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_schreiber/{size}/209563_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T17:16:19.409Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôd start debugging one problem at a time. Let‚Äôs focus on the drive wheels reflecting the behaviors you‚Äôd expect and then move on to the steering.

From a hardware perspective, I‚Äôm assuming Rev Swerve?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-03-19T17:16:19.409Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":258,"readers_count":257,"score":61.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459255,"topic_slug":"swerve-no-move","display_username":"Andrew Schreiber","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58360,"username":"Mateo","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f4b2a3/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4297,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I'm Retired"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-no-move/459255/7","custom_user_title":"I'm Retired","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3337253,"name":"","username":"Mateo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f4b2a3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T17:23:00.341Z","cooked":"

yep, rev swerve

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-03-19T17:23:00.341Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":59.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459255,"topic_slug":"swerve-no-move","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":4297,"username":"Andrew_Schreiber","name":"Andrew Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_schreiber/{size}/209563_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58360,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-no-move/459255/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3337283,"name":"Andrew Schreiber","username":"Andrew_Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_schreiber/{size}/209563_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T17:38:59.177Z","cooked":"

Ok, because we‚Äôre running the same hardware we can confirm you should need to invert the drive sparks. So, somewhere around RobustSturdy3/src/main/java/frc/robot/drivetrain/SwerveModule.java at main ¬∑ Mateo-Johnson/RobustSturdy3 ¬∑ GitHub you‚Äôll need

drivingSparkMax.setInverted(true); (I‚Äôd suggest you extract that true to a constant as you do in other places but it‚Äôs clearer without that)

You‚Äôll also need to invert turning but it looks like that is correct.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-03-19T17:38:59.177Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459255,"topic_slug":"swerve-no-move","display_username":"Andrew Schreiber","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Mateo-Johnson/RobustSturdy3/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/drivetrain/SwerveModule.java#L77","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"RobustSturdy3/src/main/java/frc/robot/drivetrain/SwerveModule.java at main ¬∑ Mateo-Johnson/RobustSturdy3 ¬∑ GitHub","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58360,"username":"Mateo","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f4b2a3/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4297,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I'm Retired"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-no-move/459255/9","custom_user_title":"I'm Retired","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3337301,"name":"","username":"Mateo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f4b2a3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T17:44:45.619Z","cooked":"

huh, thats really strange, because we ran this on a practice bot and it was fine?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-03-19T17:44:45.619Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":40.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459255,"topic_slug":"swerve-no-move","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":4297,"username":"Andrew_Schreiber","name":"Andrew Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_schreiber/{size}/209563_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58360,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-no-move/459255/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3337304,"name":"Andrew Schreiber","username":"Andrew_Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_schreiber/{size}/209563_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T17:47:47.919Z","cooked":"

Was the mechanical set up identical? If so, weird that we had to invert ours.

The other debugging option you could have is to run them open loop instead of in velocity control mode. From there plot the wheel velocity and make sure it behaves as expected.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-03-19T17:47:47.919Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":42.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459255,"topic_slug":"swerve-no-move","display_username":"Andrew Schreiber","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58360,"username":"Mateo","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f4b2a3/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4297,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I'm Retired"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-no-move/459255/11","custom_user_title":"I'm Retired","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3337309,"name":"","username":"Mateo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f4b2a3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T17:49:38.112Z","cooked":"

the hardware setup was pretty much identical, except for the fact that the swerve modules are in diff positions. it could be a sparkmax issue though, like something is inverted that shouldnt be

Any errors on the rio console in dashboard? We chased a velocity controller issue for several hours because our config wasn‚Äôt getting written correctly due to a typo resulting in trying to write NaN as a feed forward constant.

We had this same problem on our preseason bot, CHECK TO MAKE SURE THE INBUILT ENCODER WIRES ARE GOING TO THE RIGHT SPARKS! My team spent WEEKS diagnosing, dismantling, rebuilding, and stressing over this problem only to find out the relative encoder wires were going to the wrong Sparks. (eg. steering encoder wire went to the drive spark and the drive encoder wire went to the steering spark)

yo ppl, ANYONE WHO USES THE REV SWERVE CODE EXAMPLE. IF YOUR ROBOT JUST MOVES FORWARD AND BACKWARD CHANGE THE INBUILT PID VALUES IN YOUR CONSTANTS FILE. YOUR DRIVING PID SHOULD BE 1, AND THE TURNING PID SHOULD BE 0.4!!!
